required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Dexmedetomidine for LISA Procedure in Preterm Infants
clinical_study.official_title: Dexmedetomidine for LISA Procedure in Preterm Infants: a Pilot Study

brief_summary.textblock: The investigators aim to evaluate: the effectiveness of dexmedetomidine for analgesia and sedation during LISA procedure, without compromising the respiratory drive; the safety of this drug on the preterm infant in a pilot study.

detailed_description.textblock: Information will be given to parents of preterm babies <36 wGA upon their admission to the NICU (neonatal intensive care unit), and informed consent will be obtained as soon as possible. Eligible babies for LISA procedure (dyspneic and FiO2 > 0.30 on CPAP pressure of at least 6 cmH2O) undergo sedation with dexmedetomidine 1 mcg/kg, administered slowly iv in 10 minutes, together with non pharmacological techniques. After the step of sedation LISA is performed. Before/during and after the procedure pain will be assessed by the NIPS scale and the quality of intubation will be evaluated; then other events related to the procedure will be strictly collected for the first 24 hours. Babies will then be managed in usual NICU way and clinical data will be unregistered on respiratory, neurological and hemodynamic outcomes during the hospital stay, and especially at discharge.

primary_outcome.measure: effectiveness of dexmedetomidine in achieving sedation for LISA procedure
primary_outcome.time_frame: basal (before procedure), during and immediately after the procedure
primary_outcome.description: evaluation of changes in Neonatal Infant Pain Scale (NIPS) score (0-2 points= no pain, 3-4 points = moderate pain; > 4 = severe pain)

primary_outcome.measure: Safety of dexmedetomidine in sedating preterm infants
primary_outcome.description: evaluation of number of apneas ( > 20 seconds or < 20 seconds with bradycardia < 100 bpm or desaturation ( SpO2 < 85%)); number of severe apnea and bradycardia (defined by the American Academy of Pediatrics Guidelines as apnea > 30 seconds and/or heart rate < 60 beats/minute for more than 10 seconds); need for intubation.

secondary_outcome.measure: number of laryngoscopies needed to perform LISA
secondary_outcome.description: calculate the number of laryngoscopies needed to perform LISA
calculate the time needed to perform LISA
evaluated by the operator using the Goldberg scale (3 = excellent intubation conditions; 4-6= good intubation conditions; 7-9 = poor intubation conditions; 10-12 = inadequate intubation conditions)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 1 min, 3 min, 5 min, 15 min, 30 min, 60 min and 120 min after the first drug injection
1 min, 3 min, 5 min, 15 min, 30 min, 60 min and 120 min after the first drug injection
1 min, 3 min, 5 min, 15 min, 30 min, 60 min and 120 min after the first drug injection
1 min, 3 min, 5 min, 15 min, 30 min, 60 min and 120 min after the first drug injection
1 min, 3 min, 5 min, 15 min, 30 min, 60 min and 120 min after the first drug injection
secondary_outcome.description: FiO2 maxima during the procedure maintained for at least 30 seconds (%)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 1 min, 3 min, 5 min, 15 min, 30 min, 60 min and 120 min after the first drug injection
secondary_outcome.description: inspiratory and end-expiratory ventilation pressures changes (cmH2O)

secondary_outcome.measure: The incidence of drug adverse effects
secondary_outcome.description: respiratory events (i.e. bronchospasm) or cardiovascular events (bradycardia, hypotension)

secondary_outcome.measure: The incidence of pneumothorax or selective administration of surfactant

secondary_outcome.description: bronchopulmonary dysplasia (%), defined as oxygen administration and/or respiratory support at 36 wGA

arm_group.arm_group_label: Every preterm newborns 26+0 -36+6 wGA with RDS needing surfactant therapy
arm_group.description: Every preterm newborns 26+0-36+6 wGA who undergoes LISA procedure will receive sedation with dexmedetomidine in order to evaluate its efficacy in achieving pain control and comfort.

intervention.description: administrating dexmedetomidine in order to evaluate the efficacy in achieving sedation for LISA procedure
intervention.arm_group_label: Every preterm newborns 26+0 -36+6 wGA with RDS needing surfactant therapy

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Preterm newborns between 26+0 and 36+6 weeks of gestation stratified in two groups: VLBWI 26-31+6and LBWI 32-36+6.
2. Respiratory distress syndrome requiring surfactant therapy
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Need for emergency intubation in the delivery room
2. Major congenital malformations (such as cardiopathies)
3. Chromosomic abnormalities
4. Fetal Hydrops
5. Hypercapnia: CO2 > 65 mmHg
6. Pneumothorax
7. Hemodynamic compromise
